data.title: Custom Split Function
data.statement: Create your own string-splitting function which includes the separator on both sides of each split.  For example, splitting the string "Hello World!" with the separator "o", would result in the array ["Hello", "o Wo", "orld!"].

testCases.title: Short String
testCases.testIn:
What a very short string.
a
testCases.testOut:
Wha
at a
a very short string.

testCases.title: Short String
testCases.testIn:
Still quite the short string.
t
testCases.testOut:
St
till quit
te t
the short
t st
tring.

testCases.title: Longer String
testCases.testIn:
Well, this is a longer string, but it should still be easy to solve.
r
testCases.testOut:
Well, this is a longer
r str
ring, but it should still be easy to solve.

testCases.title: Longer String
testCases.testIn:
What a very, very, VERY, long string for you to split.
r
testCases.testOut:
What a ver
ry, ver
ry, VERY, long str
ring for
r you to split.

testCases.title: Random Characters
testCases.testOut:
ao
oiekm;x,mpo
oiapo
otk'ljp83u40-askml,mpo
oidhpaejnrg;lkamepo
o8ehpo
oij398jlkmv.,

testCases.title: Multiple Character Seperator
testCases.testIn:
Once upon a time, there was a time that time no longer held any hold on the time. It was a very sad time for time. Boy, what a time.
time
testCases.testOut:
Once upon a time
time, there was a time
time that time
time no longer held any hold on the time
time. It was a very sad time
time for time
time. Boy, what a time
time.

testCases.title: Multiple Character Seperator
testCases.testIn:
Well, isn't today a crazy day.  It was a crazy day yesterday as well.  There have been way too many crazy days since last Tuesday.
day
testCases.testOut:
Well, isn't today
day a crazy day
day.  It was a crazy day
day yesterday
day as well.  There have been way too many crazy day
days since last Tuesday
day.

data.stubGenerator:
read S:string(256)
read R:string(256)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[S]] to split
<<Line 2:>> A string [[R]] to separate [[S]] around.
data.outputDescription: Multiple lines, each containing one element of the resulting string array.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Create your own string-splitting function which includes the separator on both sides of each split. For example, splitting the string "Hello World!" with the separator "o", would result in the array ["Hello", "o Wo", "orld!"].
Input
Line 1: A string S to split
Line 2: A string R to separate S around.
Output
Multiple lines, each containing one element of the resulting string array.
Constraints
Example
Input
What a very short string.
a
Output
Wha
at a
a very short string.
